```
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
```
    }
```
}
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else {
            boolean isUsedInJavadoc = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTJavadoc.class)
                .flatMap(javadoc -> javadoc.descendants(ASTJavadocElement.class))
                .filter(javadocElement -> {
                    if (javadocElement instanceof ASTJavadocLink) {
                        return ((ASTJavadocLink) javadocElement).getQualifiedName().equals(importedName);
                    } else if (javadocElement instanceof ASTJavadocValue) {
                        return ((ASTJavadocValue) javadocElement).getQualifiedName().equals(importedName);
                    } else if (javadocElement instanceof ASTJavadocSeeTag) {
                        return ((ASTJavadocSeeTag) javadocElement).getQualifiedName().equals(importedName);
                    } else if (javadocElement instanceof ASTJavadocThrowsTag) {
                        return ((ASTJavadocThrowsTag) javadocElement).getQualifiedName().equals(importedName);
                    }
                    return false;
                })
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsedInJavadoc) {
                boolean isUsedInCode = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsedInCode) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else {
            boolean isUsedInCode = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            boolean isUsedInJavadoc = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTJavadoc.class)
                .filter(javadoc -> javadoc.getText().contains(importedName))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsedInCode && !isUsedInJavadoc) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else {
            boolean isUsedInCode = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            boolean isUsedInJavadoc = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTJavadoc.class)
                .flatMap(javadoc -> javadoc.descendants(ASTJavadocElement.class))
                .filter(javadocElement -> {
                    if (javadocElement instanceof ASTJavadocReference) {
                        ASTJavadocReference ref = (ASTJavadocReference) javadocElement;
                        return ref.getQualifiedName().equals(importedName);
                    }
                    return false;
                })
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsedInCode && !isUsedInJavadoc) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

```
// #1306 False positive on duplicate when using static imports
import static org.junit.Assert.*;
            import static net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle.UnnecessaryImportTest.*;
            import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
            // this import is needed for disambiguation - as DuplicateImportsTest
            // defines assertTrue with the same signature, too.

            public class DuplicateImports {
                static {
                    assertTrue("", true); // the one from the disambiguation import
                    assertSomething("", true); // from UnnecessaryImportTest.*
                    assertFalse("", true); // from Assert.*
                }
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else {
            boolean isDuplicate = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTImportDeclaration.class)
                .filter(importDecl -> importDecl != node && importDecl.getImportedName().equals(importedName))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (isDuplicate) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

True

===============================新加一个测试用例生成的checker repair_test_error_query_when_testing==========================
You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

        staticMethod("This is OK");
    }

```
import static org.junit.Assert.*;
            import static net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle.UnnecessaryImportTest.*;
            import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
            // this import is needed for disambiguation - as DuplicateImportsTest
            // defines assertTrue with the same signature, too.

            public class DuplicateImports {
                static {
                    assertTrue("", true); // the one from the disambiguation import
                    assertSomething("", true); // from UnnecessaryImportTest.*
                    assertFalse("", true); // from Assert.*
                }
            }
```

Please help me repair this checker according to rule description by adding or modifying some code logic to check this negative test case as well as those passed test cases.

Please give me the complete checker code including the import info, do not contain pseudocode, and do not give it step by step. No comment needed.

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else {
            boolean isDuplicate = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTImportDeclaration.class)
                .filter(importDecl -> importDecl != node && importDecl.getImportedName().equals(importedName))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (isDuplicate) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        if (node.isStatic() && node.getRoot().descendants(ASTImportDeclaration.class)
            .filter(importDecl -> importDecl.isStatic() && importDecl.getImportedName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
            .count() > 1) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```
import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {

                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        if (node.isStatic() && node.getRoot().descendants(ASTImportDeclaration.class)
            .filter(importDecl -> importDecl != node && importDecl.isStatic() && importDecl.getImportedName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
            .nonEmpty()) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else {
            List<ASTImportDeclaration> imports = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTImportDeclaration.class).toList();
            for (ASTImportDeclaration importDecl : imports) {
                if (importDecl != node && importDecl.getImportedName().equals(importedName) && importDecl.isStatic() == node.isStatic()) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                    break;
                }
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
编译是否通过？
True
测试是否通过
False

You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```
import java.lang.*;

public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {

                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();

                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {

            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {

                }
            } else {

                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);

            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```
import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;

public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();

            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
```
        } else {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```

import java.util.*;

import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }

```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {

                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {

                }

                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {

                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();

                isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }

```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
```
        } else {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
编译是否通过？
True

===============================新加一个测试用例生成的checker repair_test_error_query_when_testing==========================
You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            addViolation(data, node);
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
```
        } else {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();

                addViolation(data, node);
            }

        return super.visit(node, data);
```
