package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
```
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
```
```
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.invoke.")) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```
            } else {

                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                        .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(importedName))
                        .nonEmpty();
                    if (!isUsed) {
                        addViolation(data, node);
                    }
                }
            } else {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

True

===============================新加一个测试用例生成的checker repair_test_error_query_when_testing==========================
You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(node.getImportedName().substring(node.getImportedName().lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                String importedPackage = node.getImportedName();
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getTypeMirror().getPackageName().equals(importedPackage))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                String importedPackage = node.getImportedName();
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getTypeMirror().getPackageName().equals(importedPackage))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
编译是否通过？
False
编译错误不在预期范围内，重新生成
迭代测试用例时， 2轮内编译不通过，pass，重新来一轮编译修复生成修复测试用例后的checker
===============================新加一个测试用例生成的checker repair_test_error_query_when_testing==========================
You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                String importedPackage = node.getImportedName();
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getTypeMirror().getPackageName().equals(importedPackage))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {

                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }

                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedPackage.substring(importedPackage.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {

                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();

                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;

import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

                }

                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();

                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {

            }

            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();

                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {

                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
```

        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);

                    .nonEmpty();

                    addViolation(data, node);

            return super.visit(node, data);

                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {

            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {

                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```
import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;

    }

                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }

            return super.visit(node, data);

                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty() ||
                node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;

import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;

public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                String importedPackage = node.getImportedName();
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getTypeMirror().getPackageName().equals(importedPackage))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

===============================新加一个测试用例生成的checker repair_test_error_query_when_testing==========================
You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                String importedPackage = node.getImportedName();
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getTypeMirror().getPackageName().equals(importedPackage))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                String importedPackage = node.getImportedName();
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getTypeMirror().getPackageName().equals(importedPackage))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {

            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
```
