```
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
```
    }
```
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                String importedName = node.getImportedName();
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getTypeMirror().getSymbol().getPackageName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();

                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                String importedName = node.getImportedName();
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getTypeMirror().getSymbol().getPackageName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You are an expert in writing java rule checkers in PMD tool version 7.0.0. 
You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    boolean isClassUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                        .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(node.getImportedName().substring(node.getImportedName().lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                        .nonEmpty();
                    if (!isClassUsed) {
                        addViolation(data, node);
                    }
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                boolean isClassUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(node.getImportedName().substring(node.getImportedName().lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isClassUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    boolean isNestedClassUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                        .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(node.getImportedName().substring(node.getImportedName().lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                        .nonEmpty();
                    if (!isNestedClassUsed) {
                        addViolation(data, node);
                    }
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                boolean isNestedClassUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(node.getImportedName().substring(node.getImportedName().lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isNestedClassUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    boolean isNestedClassUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                        .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(node.getImportedName().substring(node.getImportedName().lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                        .nonEmpty();
                    if (!isNestedClassUsed) {
                        addViolation(data, node);
                    }
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                boolean isNestedClassUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(node.getImportedName().substring(node.getImportedName().lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isNestedClassUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    boolean isClassUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                        .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(node.getImportedName().substring(node.getImportedName().lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                        .nonEmpty();
                    if (!isClassUsed) {
                        addViolation(data, node);
                    }
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                boolean isClassUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(node.getImportedName().substring(node.getImportedName().lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isClassUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    boolean isClassUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                        .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(node.getImportedName().substring(node.getImportedName().lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                        .nonEmpty();
                    if (!isClassUsed) {
                        addViolation(data, node);
                    }
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                boolean isClassUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(node.getImportedName().substring(node.getImportedName().lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isClassUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

```
// #4432 - Necessary import for interface method
package p;

            import static p.Top2.foo;

            class Klass implements Top {
                static {
                    foo(); // This is Top2.foo
                }

                static class Child {
                    {
                        foo(); // This is also Top2.foo
                    }
                }
            }
            interface Top {
                static void foo() {}
            }
            interface Top2 {
                static void foo() {}
            }
The number of violating the rule in this test case is: 0
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> {
                    String methodName = methodCall.getMethodName();
                    String importedMethodName = node.getImportedName();
                    if (methodName.equals(importedMethodName)) {
                        return true;
                    }
                    return false;
                })
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

```
// #4432 - Necessary import for interface method
package p;

            import static p.Top2.foo;

            class Klass implements Top {
                static {
                    foo(); // This is Top2.foo
                }

                static class Child {
                    {
                        foo(); // This is also Top2.foo
                    }
                }
            }
            interface Top {
                static void foo() {}
            }
            interface Top2 {
                static void foo() {}
            }
```

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            } else {
                boolean isAmbiguous = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                    .count() > 1;
                if (isAmbiguous) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            } else {
                boolean isAmbiguous = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                    .count() > 1;
                if (isAmbiguous) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;

import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();

                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> {
                    String methodName = methodCall.getMethodName();
                    return methodName.equals(node.getImportedName()) || methodName.equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1));
                })
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

You have helped me write a checker for this rule:
Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;

```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;

import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();

                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
```

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();

                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();

            }

================修复新加测试用例后生成的checker===================
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> {
                    String methodName = methodCall.getMethodName();
                    String importedMethodName = node.getImportedName();
                    if (importedMethodName.contains(".")) {
                        importedMethodName = importedMethodName.substring(importedMethodName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1);
                    }
                    return methodName.equals(importedMethodName);
                })
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}

Rule description: Reports import statements that can be removed. They are either unused, duplicated, or the members they import are already implicitly in scope, because they’re in java.lang, or the current package.;
And the source code of the checker is as follows:
```
package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.codestyle;

import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;


import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.AbstractJavaRulechainRule;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.ast.internal. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.types. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.symbols. *;
import net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.NodeStream;
public class UnnecessaryImportRule extends AbstractJavaRulechainRule {
    public UnnecessaryImportRule() {
        super(ASTImportDeclaration.class);
    }

    @Override
    public Object visit(ASTImportDeclaration node, Object data) {
        if (node.isImportOnDemand()) {
            if (node.isStatic()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                    .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().startsWith(node.getImportedName()))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
            return super.visit(node, data);
        }

        String importedName = node.getImportedName();
        if (importedName.startsWith("java.lang.") || importedName.startsWith("java.io.")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isShadowed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName.substring(importedName.lastIndexOf('.') + 1)))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isShadowed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (!importedName.contains(".")) {
            String packageName = node.getRoot().getPackageName();
            if (packageName != null && !packageName.isEmpty()) {
                boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTClassOrInterfaceType.class)
                    .filter(type -> type.getSimpleName().equals(importedName))
                    .nonEmpty();
                if (!isUsed) {
                    addViolation(data, node);
                }
            } else {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        } else if (node.isStatic()) {
            boolean isUsed = node.getRoot().descendants(ASTMethodCall.class)
                .filter(methodCall -> methodCall.getMethodName().equals(node.getImportedName()))
                .nonEmpty();
            if (!isUsed) {
                addViolation(data, node);
            }
        }

        return super.visit(node, data);
    }
}
```
